race.name: Le Grand du Nord
race.tagline: UCI Gravel World Series race through Minnesota's stunning North Shore at Lake Superior.

vitals.registration: UCI Gravel World Series registration. Cost: $90-$140

climate.description: Cool temps (45-65°F) with Lake Superior effect. Spring wet season—20-30% rain chance.
challenges: Lake Superior brings cool temps and wind

terrain.surface: 70% gravel/dirt forest roads, 20% paved, 10% technical doubletrack. Smoother than mountain gravel but constant rolling terrain.

gravel_god_rating.tier_override_reason: Largest gravel event in Quebec (1,500+ riders), high production value, scenic Gunflint Trail route

biased_opinion.summary: Le Grand du Nord is Minnesota's entry into the UCI Gravel World Series—2,000+ riders racing through the stunning North Shore of Lake Superior at peak spring green. The course rolls through dense Northwoods, climbs for Lake Superior overlooks, and finishes in the tourist town of Grand Marais. It's not the hardest course (5,000 ft over 110 miles = rolling, not mountainous), but the field is international and fast. The scenery is world-class: dense Minnesota woods, Lake Superior vistas, and the iconic Gunflint Trail. Grand Marais is the perfect race town—hotels, restaurants, breweries, and post-race tourism. The large field means pack racing early and potential bottlenecks, but it thins out. This is a big-event, well-organized UCI race with all the amenities.
strengths: UCI Gravel World Series—international field and prestige
Stunning North Shore scenery—Lake Superior and Minnesota Northwoods
Grand Marais is perfect race town—great lodging, food, tourism
Large field (2,000+ riders) creates energy and competition
weaknesses: Large field = pack racing early, potential bottlenecks
Spring weather unpredictable—rain and mud possible
Lodging pressure—Grand Marais is popular, book early
Travel logistics—Duluth airport 2 hours away, or 4+ hours from Minneapolis
Course is rolling but not extreme—less challenge than mountain gravel
biased_opinion.bottom_line: If you want a big, well-organized UCI race with stunning scenery and a competitive international field—Le Grand du Nord delivers. The North Shore is one of the most beautiful places in the Midwest. Grand Marais is a perfect race destination. The course is rolling but not brutal. This is a showcase event, not a suffer fest. Bring fitness for pack racing, expect UCI-level competition, and make it a weekend trip. The views and post-race tourism are worth it.

logistics.lodging_note: Grand Marais is tourist town with hotels/B&Bs. Book 2-3 months ahead. State parks nearby for camping.
logistics.travel_summary: Duluth airport 2 hours away. Rental car needed. Grand Marais is popular—book lodging early.
logistics.food_options: Multiple aid stations. Post-race: Grand Marais has great restaurants/breweries.
logistics.camping: Judge CR Magney State Park, Cascade River State Park

course_description.character: Rolling terrain through Minnesota Northwoods. 5,000 ft over 110 miles = constant ups and downs, no sustained climbs. Mix of smooth gravel forest roads (70%), paved sections (20%), and technical doubletrack (10%). Smoother than mountain gravel but never flat.

suffering_zones.name: Lake Superior Overlook Climb
suffering_zones.description: Steep, scenic climb with Lake Superior views. Pack may still be together here—surges happen.
suffering_zones.survival_strategy: Steep pitch when legs are warming up. Scenic but painful. Pack surges here.

suffering_zones.name: Gunflint Trail Rollers
suffering_zones.description: Constant rolling terrain through Northwoods. No recovery. Beautiful but relentless.
suffering_zones.survival_strategy: 20 miles of rolling ups and downs. Never flat. Accumulates fatigue.

suffering_zones.name: Technical Doubletrack
suffering_zones.description: Rooty, rocky sections demanding focus when tired.
suffering_zones.survival_strategy: Technical riding when exhausted. Roots and rocks demand attention.

course_description.signature_challenge: Steep, scenic climb with Lake Superior views. Pack may still be together here—surges happen.

history.origin_story: Large field (2,000+ riders). UCI Gravel World Series brings international competition.
notable_moments: 2024: Dry, cool (48-62°F). Perfect conditions. Low DNF (~5%).
2023: Rain day before. Muddy sections. ~10% DNF.
